intro: Panicum miliaceum var. album, commonly known as white proso millet, is an annual grass species native to temperate regions of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in panicles. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are typically harvested when dry and mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and as a nutritious grain crop.
